info.title: Registry API
info.description:
**This is a view of *all Registry methods* available for advanced use.  Most users of GBIF data will prefer the [Registry API — Principal methods](registry-principal-methods) page instead.**

This API works against the GBIF Registry, which makes all registered Datasets, Installations, Organizations, Nodes, and Networks discoverable.

Internally we use a Java web service client for the consumption of these HTTP-based, RESTful web services. It may be of interest to those coding against the API, and can be found in the [registry-ws-client](https://github.com/gbif/registry/tree/master/registry-ws-client) project.

tags.name: Datasets
tags.description:
A GBIF **dataset** provides occurrence data, checklist data, sampling event data or metadata. Publishing organizations register datasets in this Registry, and the data they reference is retrieved and indexed in GBIF's occurrence store on a regular schedule.

Metadata of datasets follows the GBIF Metadata Profile.

The dataset API provides CRUD and discovery services for datasets. Its most prominent use on the GBIF portal is to drive the [dataset search](https://www.gbif.org/dataset/search) and dataset pages.

Please note deletion of datasets is logical, meaning dataset entries remain registered forever and only get a deleted timestamp. On the other hand, deletion of a dataset's contacts, endpoints, identifiers, tags, machine tags, comments, and metadata descriptions is physical, meaning the entries are permanently removed.

tags.name: Publishing organizations
tags.description:
A **publishing organization** is an institution endorsed by a GBIF Node to publish datasets to GBIF.

The organization API provides CRUD and discovery services for organizations. Its most prominent use on the GBIF portal is to drive the [data publisher search](https://www.gbif.org/publisher/search).

Please note deletion of organizations is logical, meaning organization entries remain registered forever and only get a deleted timestamp. On the other hand, deletion of an organizations's contacts, endpoints, identifiers, tags, machine tags, comments, and metadata descriptions is physical, meaning the entries are permanently removed.

tags.name: Participant nodes
tags.description:
Each of GBIF's formal participants designates and establishes a **node** responsible for coordinating GBIF-related in-country activities.

The nodes API provides CRUD and discovery services for nodes. Its most prominent use on the GBIF portal is to drive the [GBIF network page](https://www.gbif.org/the-gbif-network) and country pages.

Please note deletion of nodes is logical, meaning node entries remain registered forever and only get a deleted timestamp. On the other hand, deletion of a nodes's endpoints, identifiers, tags, machine tags, comments, and metadata descriptions is physical, meaning the entries are permanently removed.

Also note, nodes are managed in a different, internal GBIF system, so the usual create-update-delete methodsexist but are not documented here.

tags.name: Networks
tags.description:
**Networks** are collections of datasets, organized outside the Node-Organization model to serve some purpose.

The largest network is [Ocean Biodiversity Information Systems (OBIS)](https://www.gbif.org/network/2b7c7b4f-4d4f-40d3-94de-c28b6fa054a6).

The dataset API provides CRUD and discovery services for networks. Networks are arbitrary collections of datasets grouped for some purpose.

Please note deletion of networks is logical, meaning network entries remain registered forever and only get a deleted timestamp. On the other hand, deletion of a network's contacts, endpoints, identifiers, tags, machine tags, comments, and metadata descriptions is physical, meaning the entries are permanently removed.

tags.name: Technical installations
tags.description:
A **technical installation** serves datasets.  They usually represent installations of the [GBIF IPT](https://www.gbif.org/ipt) or other HTTP-accessible data repositories.

The installation API provides CRUD and discovery services for installations.

Please note deletion of installations is logical, meaning installation entries remain registered forever and only get a deleted timestamp. On the other hand, deletion of an installation's contacts, endpoints, identifiers, tags, machine tags, comments, and metadata descriptions is physical, meaning the entries are permanently removed.

tags.name: Collections
tags.description:
The collections API provides CRUD services for collections, institutions and person entities. The data was originally migrated from the Global Registry of Scientific Collections (GRSciColl) and adapted to follow the same conventions as other registry services. Therefore, the deletion of collections, institutions and persons is logical, meaning these entries remain registered forever and only get a deleted timestamp. On the other hand, the deletion of tags and identifiers is physical, meaning the entries are permanently removed.

*Please note that this part of the API is still under development, and may change in the future.*

## Collection
This API provides CRUD services for the collection entity. A collection can be associated with an institution and can have a list of contacts, which are represented by the person entity. It can also have tags and identifiers.

tags.name: Institutions
tags.description: This API provides CRUD services for the institution entity. An institution can have a list of contacts, which are represented by the person entity. They can also have tags and identifiers.

tags.name: Lookup institutions and collections
tags.description: This API provides a service to lookup institutions and collections. It can be used to lookup for institutions, collections or both at the same time. Besides the matches, the response also provides information to help understand how the match was done.

tags.name: Search institutions and collections
tags.description: This API provides a service to search institutions and collections. It searches in both institutions and collections and it highlights the matching fields (optional).

tags.name: GRSciColl Audit log
tags.description: This services provides an audit log that tracks all the changes made to GRSciColl entities. Its usage is reserved for administrators.

tags.name: OAI-PMH
tags.description:
In addition to the RESTful JSON API, Datasets are exposed using [OAI-PMH](https://www.openarchives.org/pmh/). Two metadata formats can be retrieved: Ecological Metadata Language (EML) and OAI Dublin Core. Datasets are grouped into sets according to type, country and installation.

### Example queries
Example queries:
* Retrieve information about the OAI-PMH service:   [Identify](https://api.gbif.org/v1/oai-pmh/registry?verb=Identify).
* Retrieve a list of available sets (dataset types, countries and serving installations):   [ListSets](https://api.gbif.org/v1/oai-pmh/registry?verb=ListSets).
  Sets have names like `dataset_type:CHECKLIST` and `country:NL`.
* Retrieve the identifiers for all datasets from a particular installation:   [ListIdentifiers](https://api.gbif.org/v1/oai-pmh/registry?verb=ListIdentifiers&metadataPrefix=oai_dc).
  According to the OAI-PMH protocol, metadataPrefix must be set to either oai_dc or eml, even though both formats   are supported for all datasets.
* Retrieve the metadata for all datasets served by installations in a country:   [ListRecords](https://api.gbif.org/v1/oai-pmh/registry?verb=ListRecords&metadataPrefix=oai_dc&set=Country:TG).
  Country codes are based on the ISO 3166-1 standard.
* Some queries will return more than one page of results. In this case, the XML will end with a resumption token   element, for example: `<resumptionToken cursor="1">MToxMDB8Mjpjb3VudHJ5Ok5MfDM6fDQ6fDU6b2FpX2Rj</resumptionToken>`   The second page of results can be retrieved like this:   [Resume](https://api.gbif.org/v1/oai-pmh/registry?verb=ListRecords&resumptionToken=MToxMDB8MjpDb3VudHJ5Ok5MfDM6fDQ6fDU6b2FpX2Rj).

externalDocs.description: The Open Archives Initiative Protocol for Metadata Harvesting

tags.name: Enumerations
tags.description: This API provides JSON serializations of all enumerations in the GBIF API.

tags.name: Derived datasets
tags.description: Derived datasets are metadata records allowing the citation of a subset of a larger dataset.  Typically the large dataset is a monthly download containing all GBIF occurrences and made available on a public cloud service.

post.summary: Create a new derived dataset
post.description: Creates a new derived dataset with the specified source dataset and records of what subset should be cited.

requestBody.description: The request body should contain the parameters below.  Note the `relatedDatasets` map may use GBIF Dataset DOIs or UUIDs as keys, with the values being the number of records to cite from each dataset.

get.summary: An inventory of all enumerations
List all collections
get.description: Lists all current collections (deleted collections are not listed).

parameters.name: institution
parameters.description: A key for the institution. Deprecated: use institutionKey instead.

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description: Content type of a GrSciColl collection. Accepts multiple values, for example `contentType=Paleontological&contentType=EarthPlanetary`.

parameters.name: preservationType
parameters.description: Preservation type of a GrSciColl collection. Accepts multiple values, for example `preservationType=SampleCryopreserved&preservationType=SampleFluidPreserved`.

parameters.name: accessionStatus
parameters.description: Accession status of a GrSciColl collection. Accepts multiple values, for example `accessionStatus=Institutional&accessionStatus=Project

parameters.name: personalCollection
parameters.description: Flag for personal GRSciColl collections

parameters.name: sourceId
parameters.description: sourceId of MasterSourceMetadata

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Source attribute of MasterSourceMetadata

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Code of a GrSciColl institution or collection

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of a GrSciColl institution or collection

parameters.name: alternativeCode
parameters.description: Alternative code of a GrSciColl institution or collection

parameters.name: contact
parameters.description: Filters collections and institutions whose contacts contain the person key specified

parameters.name: machineTagNamespace
parameters.description: Filters for entities with a machine tag in the specified namespace.

parameters.name: machineTagName
parameters.description: Filters for entities with a machine tag with the specified name (use in combination with the machineTagNamespace parameter).

parameters.name: machineTagValue
parameters.description: Filters for entities with a machine tag with the specified value (use in combination with the machineTagNamespace and machineTagName parameters).

parameters.name: identifierType
parameters.description: An identifier type for the identifier parameter.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: An identifier of the type given by the identifierType parameter, for example a DOI or UUID.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: Filters by country given as a ISO 639-1 (2 letter) country code.

externalDocs.description: API call to retrieve all official values.

parameters.name: gbifRegion
parameters.description: Filters by a gbif region

schema.description:
An enumeration for all GBIF Regions. These are based on [IPBES regions](https://www.nature.com/articles/sdata20167/figures/1).

*This is a political division,* part of GBIF's governance structure.

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: Filters by the city of the address. It searches in both the physical and the mailing address.

parameters.name: fuzzyName
parameters.description: It searches by name fuzzily so the parameter doesn't have to be the exact name

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Active status of a GrSciColl institution or collection

parameters.name: masterSourceType
parameters.description: The master source type of a GRSciColl institution or collection

parameters.name: numberSpecimens
parameters.description: Number of specimens. It supports ranges and a `*` can be used as a wildcard

parameters.name: displayOnNHCPortal
parameters.description: Flag to show this record in the NHC portal

parameters.name: replacedBy
parameters.description: Key of the entity that replaced another entity

parameters.name: occurrenceCount
parameters.description: Count of occurrences linked. It supports ranges and a `*` can be used as a wildcard

parameters.name: typeSpecimenCount
parameters.description: Count of type specimens linked. It supports ranges and a `*` can be used as a wildcard

parameters.name: institutionKey
parameters.description: Keys of institutions to filter by

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Field to sort the results by. It only supports the fields contained in the enum.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: Sort order to use with the sortBy parameter

parameters.name: contactUserId
parameters.description: Filter by contact user ID

parameters.name: contactEmail
parameters.description: Filter by contact email

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Simple full text search parameter. The value for this parameter can be a simple word or a phrase. Wildcards are not supported

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Controls the number of results in the page. Using too high a value will be overwritten with the default maximum threshold, depending on the service. Sensible defaults are used so this may be omitted.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Determines the offset for the search results. A limit of 20 and offset of 40 will get the third page of 20 results. Some services have a maximum offset.

parameters.description: Filters datasets by a case insensitive plain text keyword. The search is done on the merged collection of tags, the dataset keywordCollections and temporalCoverages.

parameters.description: Filters datasets by their temporal coverage broken down to decades. Decades are given as a full year, e.g. 1880, 1960, 2000, etc, and will return datasets wholly contained in the decade as well as those that cover the entire decade or more. schema.description:
The continent, based on a 7 continent model described on [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Continent#Number_of_continents) and the [World Geographical Scheme for Recording Plant Distributions (WGSRPD)](https://www.tdwg.org/standards/109).

In particular this splits the Americas into North and South America with North America including the Caribbean (except Trinidad and Tobago) and reaching down and including Panama.

See the [GBIF Continents](https://github.com/gbif/continents/) for the exact divisions.

*This is a geographical division.  See `GBIFRegion` for GBIF's political divisions.*

key.description: The name usage key that uniquely identifies this name usage.

nubKey.description:
The taxon key of the matching backbone name usage.

If this is equal to `key`, this name usage is a backbone name usage.

nameKey.description:
The key for retrieving a parsed name object.

*You are more likely to need the `key` or `nubKey` properties*

taxonID.description:
The original taxonID of the name usage as found in the source.

For backbone taxa and name usages with an origin different to SOURCE this is null.

sourceTaxonKey.description:
The key of the name usage from which this backbone taxon derives.

For backbone taxa the source taxon key refers to the original name usage that was used during backbone building and is the primary reason that this taxon exists in the backbone.

All backbone name usages are built from several underlying checklist usages, but these are sorted by priority and the usage key for the highest priority one becomes the sourceTaxonKey for a backbone usage.

Some backbone usages do not have any source record at all; for example if there is a subspecies found, but no matching parent species, the missing species will be created nevertheless and has no primary source.

kingdomKey.description: Name usage key of the kingdom.

phylumKey.description: Name usage key of the phylum.

classKey.description: Name usage key of the class.

orderKey.description: Name usage key of the order.

familyKey.description: Name usage key of the family.

genusKey.description: Name usage key of the genus.

subgenusKey.description: Name usage key of the subgenus.

speciesKey.description: Name usage key of the species.

datasetKey.description:
The checklist that “hosts” this name usage.

For a backbone name usage, this will be `d7dddbf4-2cf0-4f39-9b2a-bb099caae36c`.

constituentKey.description: The optional sub-dataset key for this usage.

parentKey.description: The name usage key of the immediate parent.  Null for the highest taxonomic level.

parent.description: The scientific name of the parent.

proParteKey.description:
The primary name usage key for a *pro parte* synonym.

Synonyms with multiple accepted names are grouped by a single, primary name usage key.

acceptedKey.description: The name usage key of the accepted name.

accepted.description: The scientific name of the accepted name.

basionymKey.description: The name usage key of the basionym.

basionym.description: The scientific name of the basionym.

scientificName.description:
The scientific name, with date and authorship information if available.

Examples: *Coleoptera* (order), *Vespertilionidae* (family), *Manis* (genus), *Ctenomys sociabilis* (genus + specificEpithet), *Ambystoma tigrinum diaboli* (zoology, genus + specific name + infraspecific name) *Quercus agrifolia* var. *oxyadenia* (Torr.) (botany, genus + specific epithet + infraspecific epithet + authorship)

canonicalName.description: The canonical name; the name without authorship or references.

vernacularName.description: A common or vernacular name for this usage.

authorship.description: The authorship for the scientific name.

nameType.description: The type of name string classified by Checklistbank.

origin.description:
The name usage origin.

The origin of this name usage record, the reason it exists.

In most cases this is because the record existed explicitly in the checklist sources, but some usages are created *de novo* because the exist implicitly in the data.

taxonomicStatus.description:
The taxonomic status of the name usage.

Can be null, but for all synonyms with an accepted name usage it is guaranteed to exist.

nomenclaturalStatus.description: The nomenclatural statuses of this name usage.

items.description: The nomenclatural statuses of this name usage.

publishedIn.description: Original publication for this name usage.

accordingTo.description:
The taxon concept reference.

This is usually a reference to some publication or an author and year.

The Darwin Core `taxonAccordingTo` reference is usually appended to the scientific name to further qualify the concept with “sensu” or “sec.” being used for concatenation; for example “_Acer nigrum_ sec. Gleason Cronquist 1991”.

In the case of backbone taxa, this refers to the primary checklist in which the name was found.

numDescendants.description: A total count of all accepted taxonomic elements under this usage.

references.description: A URI link or reference to the source of the record, the record's “homepage”.

modified.description: The interpreted dc:modified from the verbatim source data, ideally indicating when a record was last modified in the source.

deleted.description:
The date this record was deleted.

*Only backbone name usages are soft-deleted.*

lastCrawled.description: The date this record was last crawled (downloaded from the source) during Checklistbank indexing.

lastInterpreted.description: The date this record was last interpreted during indexing.  This includes matching to the backbone.

issues.description: Data quality issues found during Checklistbank interpretation.

lifeForm.description:
A term describing the growth/lifeform of an organism.

See [Life Form vocabulary](https://rs.gbif.org/vocabulary/gbif/life_form).

habitat.description:
Comma-separated list of major habitat classifications as defined by the IUCN in which a species is known to exist.

See [Habitats vocabulary](https://rs.gbif.org/vocabulary/iucn/habitat/).

marine.description: A Boolean flag indicating whether the taxon is a marine organism, i.e. can be found in/above sea water.

freshwater.description: Flag indicating whether the taxon is a freshwater organism.

terrestrial.description: A Boolean flag indicating the taxon is a terrestrial organism, i.e. occurs on land as opposed to the sea.

ageInDays.description: Maximum observed age of an organism given as number of days.

sizeInMillimeter.description:
Maximum observed size of an organism in millimetres.

Can be either height, length or width, whichever is greater.

massInGram.description: Maximum observed weight of an organism in grams.

source.description: Bibliographic citation referencing a source for the species profile.

sourceTaxonKey.description: The name usage key of the taxon in the checklist including this species profile.

endOfRecords.description: True if this page of search results is the final page.

count.description: The total number of records returned by the search.

key.description: The key for this parsed name object.

scientificName.description: The exact verbatim, full scientific name as given before parsing.

type.description: A coarse classification of names helping to deal with different syntactical name string structures.

genusOrAbove.description: The genus part of a bi/trinomial or the monomial in case of names of higher ranks.

infraGeneric.description: The infrageneric part of a name, often given in parentheses between genus and species epithet, e.g. for a subgenus

specificEpithet.description: The specific epithet of the name

infraSpecificEpithet.description: The infraspecific part of a name.

cultivarEpithet.description:
The cultivar, cultivar group or grex part of a cultivated plant name.

If given the name should be of type CULTIVAR

strain.description:
The strain or isolate name. Usually a capital collection code string followed by an accession number.

See [List of culture collection codes](http://www.bacterio.net/-collections.html).  If given the name should be of type STRAIN.

notho.description: For hybrid names notho indicates which part of the name is considered a hybrid, i.e. genus, species or infraspecific epithet.

authorship.description: The original author of this name, e.g. basionym or recombination author.

year.description: The year of publication as given in the authorship.

bracketAuthorship.description: The authorship of the original name, i.e. basionym, given in brackets.

bracketYear.description: The code relevant year of publication of the original name, i.e. basionym, given in brackets.

sensu.description: Taxon concept references as part of the name, e.g. “MSW2006” for *Gorilla gorilla* (Savage, 1847) sec. MSW2005

parsed.description:
A flag indicating if a name could not be parsed at all.

If false, only the scientific name, rank and potentially the name type is given.

parsedPartially.description:
The GBIF name parser cannot always parse the entire name.

This is often the case when taxonomic, nomenclatural or identification notes are added to the end of the name. In such cases when the name was only partially parsed (NameUsageIssue.PARTIALLY_PARSABLE) this flag should be true.

If the name was not parsed at all this will be false.

nomStatus.description: Any nomenclatoral remarks given in this name, e.g. nom. illeg.

canonicalName.description:
The canonical name *sensu strictu* with nothing else but three name parts at most (genus, species, infraspecific).

No rank or hybrid markers and no authorship, cultivar or strain information.

Infrageneric names are represented without a leading genus.

Unicode characters are replaced by their matching ASCII characters.

canonicalNameWithMarker.description:
The code-compliant, canonical name with three name parts at max (genus, species, infraspecific), a rank marker for infraspecific names and cultivar or strain epithets. The canonical name can be a 1, 2 or 3 parted name, but does not include any informal notes or authorships. Notho taxa will have the hybrid marker.

Unicode characters will be replaced by their matching ASCII characters.

canonicalNameComplete.description: The code-compliant, canonical name with rank and hybrid marker, authorship and cultivar or strain name included. Informal or nomenclatoral notes, concept references, subgenus and non-terminal authorships are removed.

rankMarker.description: The taxonomic rank of the name.

key.description: The name usage key that uniquely identifies this name usage.

numPhylum.description: Returns the number of phyla that are below this taxon. Typically, this would mean this usage is of something above the “phylum” taxonomic level.

numClass.description: Returns the number of classes that are below this taxon. Typically, this would mean this usage is of something above the “class” taxonomic level.

numOrder.description: Returns the number of orders that are below this taxon. Typically, this would mean this usage is of something above the “order” taxonomic level.

numFamily.description: Returns the number of families that are below this taxon. Typically, this would mean this usage is of something above the “family” taxonomic level.

numGenus.description: Returns the number of genus that are below this taxon. Typically, this would mean this usage is of something above the “genus” taxonomic level.

numSubgenus.description: Returns the number of distinct subgenera that are below this taxon. Typically, this would mean this usage is of something above the “subgenus” taxonomic level.

numSpecies.description: Returns the number of species that are below this taxon. Typically, this would mean this usage is of something above the “species” taxonomic level.

numChildren.description: Returns the number of direct taxonomic elements under this usage. “Direct” means that children should have this usageKey as their parentKey.

numDescendants.description: The number of all accepted taxonomic elements under this usage.

numSynonyms.description: Returns the number of related synonyms this usage possses.

format.description: The format the image is exposed in.

references.description: An HTML webpage that shows the image or its metadata.

description.description: A longer description for this media item.

audience.description: A class or description for whom the image is intended or useful.

created.description: The date and time this media item was created.

creator.description: The person that created the media item.

contributor.description: Any contributor in addition to the creator that helped in recording the media item.

publisher.description: An entity responsible for making the media item available.

rightsHolder.description: A person or organization owning or managing rights over the media item.

taxonKey.description: The name usage “taxon“ key to which this species profile belongs.

sourceTaxonKey.description: The name usage key of the taxon in the checklist including this media object.

identifier.description: The public URL that identifies and locates the media item.

endOfRecords.description: True if this page of search results is the final page.

count.description: The total number of records returned by the search.

endOfRecords.description: True if this page of search results is the final page.

count.description: The total number of records returned by the search.

taxonKey.description: The name usage “taxon“ key to which this species profile belongs.

locationId.description: A code for the named area this distributon record is about.

locality.description: The verbatim name of the area this distribution record is about.

externalDocs.description: API call to retrieve all official values.

status.description: Term describing the occurrence status of the organism in the given area based on how frequent the species occurs.

lifeStage.description: The distribution information pertains solely to a specific life stage of the taxon.

temporal.description:
Relevant temporal context for this entire distribution record including all properties, preferably given as a year range or single year on which the distribution record is valid.

For the same area and taxon there could therefore be several records with different temporal context, e.g. in 5-year intervals for invasive species.

threatStatus.description: Threat status of a species as defined by IUCN.

establishmentMeans.description: Term describing whether the organism occurs natively, is introduced or cultivated.

appendixCites.description:
The CITES (Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora) Appendix number under which the taxon is listed.

It is possible to have different appendix numbers for different areas, but “global” as an area is also valid.

source.description: Bibliographic citation referencing a source for the distribution.

sourceTaxonKey.description: The name usage key of the taxon in the checklist including this distribution.

startDayOfYear.description:
Seasonal temporal subcontext within the eventDate context. Useful for migratory species.

The earliest ordinal day of the year on which the distribution record is valid. Numbering starts with 1 for 1 January and ends with 365 or 366 for 31 December.

endDayOfYear.description: Seasonal temporal subcontext within the eventDate context. The latest ordinal day of the year on which the distribution record is valid.

endOfRecords.description: True if this page of search results is the final page.

count.description: The total number of records returned by the search.

key.description:
A unique GBIF identifier for the description.

This key is used in the table of contents to retrieve the detailed description.

taxonKey.description: The name usage “taxon“ key to which this species profile belongs.

type.description:
The type used to categorize paragraphs of a taxon description.

See the [Description Type vocabulary](http://rs.gbif.org/vocabulary/gbif/descriptionType).

language.description: ISO 639-1 language code used for the description.

description.description:
Any descriptive, free text matching the category given as dc:type.

The text should be either plain text or HTML.

source.description: Bibliographic citation referencing a source for the description.

sourceTaxonKey.description: The name usage key of the taxon in the checklist including this description.

creator.description: The author(s) of the textual information provided for a description.

contributor.description: An entity responsible for making contributions to the textual information provided for a description.

license.description: Official permission to do something with the resource.

endOfRecords.description: True if this page of search results is the final page.

count.description: The total number of records returned by the search.

FacetNameUsageSearchParameter.description:
The resulting facets of a search operation.  The list can be empty if no facets were requested.

If there are no values for a facet, it will not be included in the list, i.e.: a facet should have at least 1 occurrence.

endOfRecords.description: True if this page of search results is the final page.

count.description: The total number of records returned by the search.

facets.description:
The resulting facets of a search operation.  The list can be empty if no facets were requested.

If there are no values for a facet, it will not be included in the list, i.e.: a facet should have at least 1 occurrence.

endOfRecords.description: True if this page of search results is the final page.

count.description: The total number of records returned by the search.

count.description: The total number of records returned by the search.

endOfRecords.description: True if this page of search results is the final page.

count.description: The total number of records returned by the search.

externalDocs.description: API call to retrieve all official values.

AgentIdentifier.description: A list of the globally unique identifiers for the person, people, groups, or organizations responsible for assigning the Taxon to the occurrence.

Classification.description: The map of classifications associated with this occurrence keyed by checklistKey.

FacetOccurrenceSearchParameter.description:
The resulting facets of a search operation.  The list can be empty if no facets were requested.

If there are no values for a facet, it will not be included in the list, i.e.: a facet should have at least 1 occurrence.

Gadm.description:
The administrative divisions according to the [GADM database](https://gadm.org/).

This value is applied by GBIF's processing without consideration of the `stateProvince`, `county` or `locality` fields.

gid.description: The identifier in GADM for the administrative division.

name.description: The English name in GADM for the administrative division.

GadmFeature.description: A region from the GADM database.

IsoDateInterval.description: The date-time during which an Event occurred. For occurrences, this is the date-time when the event was recorded. Not suitable for a time in a geological context.

format.description: The format the image is exposed in.

references.description: An HTML webpage that shows the image or its metadata.

description.description: A longer description for this media item.

audience.description: A class or description for whom the image is intended or useful.

created.description: The date and time this media item was created.

creator.description: The person that created the media item.

contributor.description: Any contributor in addition to the creator that helped in recording the media item.

publisher.description: An entity responsible for making the media item available.

rightsHolder.description: A person or organization owning or managing rights over the media item.

identifier.description: The public URL that identifies and locates the media item.

key.description:
Unique GBIF key for the occurrence.

We aim to keep these keys stable, but this is not possible in every case.

datasetKey.description: The UUID of the GBIF dataset containing this occurrence.

publishingOrgKey.description: The UUID of the organization which publishes the dataset containing this occurrence.

networkKeys.description: Any networks to which the dataset containing this occurrence is registered.

items.description: Any networks to which the dataset containing this occurrence is registered.

installationKey.description: The UUID of the technical installation hosted the dataset containing this occurrence.

hostingOrganizationKey.description: The UUID of the publishing organization which operates the technical installation hosting the dataset containing this occurrence.

publishingCountry.description: The country, territory or island based on ISO-3166 of the organization publishing the dataset containing this occurrence.

externalDocs.description: API call to retrieve all official values.

protocol.description: The technical protocol by which this occurrence was retrieved from the publisher's systems.

lastCrawled.description: The time this occurrence was last retrieved from the publisher's systems.

lastParsed.description:
The time this occurrence was last processed by GBIF's interpretation system “Pipelines”.

This is the time the record was last changed in GBIF, **not** the time the record was last changed by the publisher.  Data is also reprocessed when we changed the taxonomic backbone, geographic data sources or other interpretation procedures.

An earlier interpretation system distinguished between “parsing” and “interpretation”, but in the current system there is only one process — the two dates will always be the same.

crawlId.description: The sequence number of the attempt by GBIF to download (”crawl”), interpret and index the dataset to which this occurrence belongs.

projectId.description: The identifier for a project, often assigned by a funded programme.

programmeAcronym.description: The identifier for a programme which funded the digitization of this occurrence.

additionalProperties.description:
The verbatim Darwin Core Archive extension fields for this occurrence.

The main key is the record class term (the row type in Darwin Core Archive), within that are  values with extension terms as keys.

The verbatim Darwin Core Archive extension fields for this occurrence.

The main key is the record class term (the row type in Darwin Core Archive), within that are  values with extension terms as keys.

items.description:
The verbatim Darwin Core Archive extension fields for this occurrence.

The main key is the record class term (the row type in Darwin Core Archive), within that are  values with extension terms as keys.

extensions.description:
The verbatim Darwin Core Archive extension fields for this occurrence.

The main key is the record class term (the row type in Darwin Core Archive), within that are  values with extension terms as keys.

basisOfRecord.description:
The values of the Darwin Core term Basis of Record which can apply to occurrences.

See GBIF's [Darwin Core Type Vocabulary](https://rs.gbif.org/vocabulary/dwc/basis_of_record.xml) for definitions.

externalDocs.description: API call to retrieve all official values.

individualCount.description: The number of individuals present at the time of the Occurrence.

occurrenceStatus.description:
A statement about the presence or absence of a Taxon at a Location.

For definitions, see the [GBIF occurrence status vocabulary](https://rs.gbif.org/vocabulary/gbif/occurrence_status/).

lifeStage.description:
The age class or life stage of the Organism(s) at the time the Occurrence was recorded.

Values are aligned to the [GBIF LifeStage vocabulary](https://registry.gbif.org/vocabulary/LifeStage/concepts)

establishmentMeans.description:
Statement about whether an organism or organisms have been introduced to a given place and time through the direct or indirect activity of modern humans.

Values are aligned to the [GBIF EstablishmentMeans vocabulary](https://registry.gbif.org/vocabulary/EstablishmentMeans/concepts),which is derived from the [Darwin Core EstablishmentMeans vocabulary](https://dwc.tdwg.org/em/).

degreeOfEstablishment.description:
The degree to which an Organism survives, reproduces, and expands its range at the given place and time.

Values are aligned to the [GBIF DegreeOfEstablishment vocabulary](https://registry.gbif.org/vocabulary/DegreeOfEstablishment/concepts),which is derived from the [Darwin Core DegreeOfEstablishment vocabulary](https://dwc.tdwg.org/doe/).

pathway.description:
The process by which an Organism came to be in a given place at a given time.

Values are aligned to the [GBIF Pathway vocabulary](https://registry.gbif.org/vocabulary/Pathway/concepts),which is derived from the [Darwin Core Pathway vocabulary](https://dwc.tdwg.org/pw/).

classifications.description: The map of classifications associated with this occurrence keyed by checklistKey.

taxonKey.description: A taxon key from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) for the most specific (lowest rank) taxon for this occurrence.  This could be a synonym, see `acceptedTaxonKey`.

kingdomKey.description: A taxon key from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) for the kingdom of thisoccurrence.

phylumKey.description: A taxon key from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) for the phylum of thisoccurrence.

classKey.description: A taxon key from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) for the class of thisoccurrence.

orderKey.description: A taxon key from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) for the order of thisoccurrence.

familyKey.description: A taxon key from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) for the family of thisoccurrence.

genusKey.description: A taxon key from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) for the genus of thisoccurrence.

subgenusKey.description: A taxon key from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) for the subgenus of thisoccurrence.

speciesKey.description: A taxon key from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) for the species of thisoccurrence.

acceptedTaxonKey.description: A taxon key from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) for the accepted taxon of this occurrence.

scientificName.description: The scientific name (including authorship) for the taxon from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) matched to this occurrence.  This could be a synonym, see also `acceptedScientificName`.

scientificNameAuthorship.description: The scientific name authorship for the taxon from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) matched to this occurrence.  This could be a synonym, see also `acceptedScientificName`.

acceptedScientificName.description: The accepted scientific name (including authorship) for the taxon from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) matched to this occurrence.

kingdom.description: The kingdom name (excluding authorship) for the kingdom from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) matched to this occurrence.

phylum.description: The phylum name (excluding authorship) for the phylum from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) matched to this occurrence.

order.description: The order name (excluding authorship) for the order from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) matched to this occurrence.

family.description: The family name (excluding authorship) for the family from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) matched to this occurrence.

genus.description: The genus name (excluding authorship) for the genus from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) matched to this occurrence.

subgenus.description: The subgenus name (excluding authorship) for the subgenus from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) matched to this occurrence.

species.description: The species name (excluding authorship) for the species from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) matched to this occurrence.

genericName.description: The genus name part of the species name from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) matched to this occurrence.

specificEpithet.description: The specific name part of the species name from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) matched to this occurrence.

infraspecificEpithet.description: The infraspecific name part of the species name from the [GBIF backbone](https://doi.org/10.15468/39omei) matched to this occurrence.

taxonRank.description: The taxonomic rank of the most specific name in the scientificName.

taxonomicStatus.description: The status of the use of the scientificName as a label for a taxon.

iucnRedListCategory.description:
The IUCN Red List Category of the taxon of this occurrence.

See the [GBIF vocabulary](https://rs.gbif.org/vocabulary/iucn/threat_status/) for the values and their definitions, and the [IUCN Red List of Threatened Species dataset in GBIF](https://doi.org/10.15468/0qnb58) for the version of the Red List GBIF's interpretation procedures are using.

dateIdentified.description: The date on which the subject was determined as representing the Taxon.

decimalLatitude.description: The geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, using the WGS84 datum) of the geographic centre of the location of the occurrence.

decimalLongitude.description: The geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, using the WGS84 datum) of the geographic centre of the location of the occurrence.

coordinatePrecision.description: A decimal representation of the precision of the coordinates given in the decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude.

coordinateUncertaintyInMeters.description: The horizontal distance (in metres) from the given decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude describing the smallest circle containing the whole of the Location.

coordinateAccuracy.description: **Deprecated.**  This value is always null.  It is an obsolete Darwin Core term.

elevation.description: Elevation (altitude) in metres above sea level.  This is not a current Darwin Core term.

elevationAccuracy.description: The value of the potential error associated with the elevation.  This is not a current Darwin Core term.

depth.description: Depth in metres below sea level.  This is not a current Darwin Core term.

depthAccuracy.description: The value of the potential error associated with the depth.  This is not a current Darwin Core term.

continent.description:
The continent, based on a 7 continent model described on [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Continent#Number_of_continents) and the [World Geographical Scheme for Recording Plant Distributions (WGSRPD)](https://www.tdwg.org/standards/109).

In particular this splits the Americas into North and South America with North America including the Caribbean (except Trinidad and Tobago) and reaching down and including Panama.

See the [GBIF Continents](https://github.com/gbif/continents/) for the exact divisions.

*This is a geographical division.  See `GBIFRegion` for GBIF's political divisions.*

externalDocs.description: API call to retrieve all official values.

stateProvince.description:
The name of the next-smaller administrative region than country (state, province, canton, department, region, etc.) in which the occurrence occurs.

This value is unaltered by GBIF's processing; see also the GADM fields.

waterBody.description: The name of the water body in which the Location occurs.

distanceFromCentroidInMeters.description: The distance in metres of the occurrence from a centroid known to be applied to occurrences during georeferencing.  This can potentially indicate low-precision georeferencing, check the values of `coordinateUncertaintyInMeters` and `georeferenceRemarks`.

higherGeography.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of geographic names less specific than the information captured in the dwc:locality term.

georeferencedBy.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who determined the georeference (spatial representation) for the dcterms:Location.

year.description: The four-digit year in which the event occurred, according to the Common Era calendar.

month.description: The integer month in which the Event occurred.

day.description: The integer day of the month on which the Event occurred.

startDayOfYear.description: The latest integer day of the year on which the Event occurred (1 for 1 January, 365 for 31 December, except in a leap year, in which case it is 366).

endDayOfYear.description: The earliest integer day of the year on which the Event occurred (1 for 1 January, 365 for 31 December, except in a leap year, in which case it is 366).

typeStatus.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of nomenclatural types (type status, typified scientific name, publication) applied to the occurrence.

typifiedName.description:
The scientific name that is based on the type specimen.

This is not yet a Darwin Core term, see the [proposal to add it](https://github.com/tdwg/dwc/issues/28).

issues.description:
A specific interpretation issue found during processing and interpretation of the record.

See the https://links.gbif.org/occurrence-issues[list of occurrence issues] and the https://gbif.github.io/gbif-api/apidocs/org/gbif/api/vocabulary/OccurrenceIssue.html[OccurrenceIssue enumeration] for possible values and definitions.

items.description:
A specific interpretation issue found during processing and interpretation of the record.

See the https://links.gbif.org/occurrence-issues[list of occurrence issues] and the https://gbif.github.io/gbif-api/apidocs/org/gbif/api/vocabulary/OccurrenceIssue.html[OccurrenceIssue enumeration] for possible values and definitions.

modified.description: The most recent date-time on which the occurrence was changed, according to the publisher.

lastInterpreted.description:
The time this occurrence was last processed by GBIF's interpretation system “Pipelines”.

This is the time the record was last changed in GBIF, **not** the time the record was last changed by the publisher.  Data is also reprocessed when we changed the taxonomic backbone, geographic data sources or other interpretation procedures.

An earlier interpretation system distinguished between “parsing” and “interpretation”, but in the current system there is only one process — the two dates will always be the same.

references.description: A related resource that is referenced, cited, or otherwise pointed to by the described resource.

license.description: A legal document giving official permission to do something with the occurrence.

externalDocs.description: API call to retrieve all official values.

organismQuantity.description: A number or enumeration value for the quantity of organisms.

organismQuantityType.description: The type of quantification system used for the quantity of organisms.

sampleSizeUnit.description: The unit of measurement of the size (time duration, length, area, or volume) of a sample in a sampling event.

sampleSizeValue.description: A numeric value for a measurement of the size (time duration, length, area, or volume) of a sample in a sampling event.

relativeOrganismQuantity.description: The relative measurement of the quantity of the organism (i.e. without absolute units).

associatedSequences.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, global unique identifier, URI) of genetic sequence information associated with the material entity.

facts.description: Measurements or facts about the the occurrence.

institutionKey.description: **Experimental.**  The UUID of the institution holding the specimen occurrence, from GRSciColl.

collectionKey.description: **Experimental.**  The UUID of the collection containing the specimen occurrence, from GRSciColl.

isInCluster.description: **Experimental.**  Whether the occurrence belongs to a machine-calculated cluster of probable duplicate occurrences.

datasetID.description: An identifier for the set of data. May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to a collection or institution.

datasetName.description: The name identifying the data set from which the record was derived.

otherCatalogNumbers.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of previous or alternate fully qualified catalogue numbers or other human-used identifiers for the same occurrence, whether in the current or any other data set or collection.

earliestEonOrLowestEonothem.description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic eon or lowest chrono-stratigraphic eonothem or the informal name ("Precambrian") attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

latestEonOrHighestEonothem.description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic eon or highest chrono-stratigraphic eonothem or the informal name ("Precambrian") attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

earliestEraOrLowestErathem.description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic era or lowest chronostratigraphic erathem attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

latestEraOrHighestErathem.description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic era or highest chronostratigraphic erathem attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

earliestPeriodOrLowestSystem.description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic period or lowest chronostratigraphic system attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

latestPeriodOrHighestSystem.description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic period or highest chronostratigraphic system attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

earliestEpochOrLowestSeries.description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic epoch or lowest chronostratigraphic series attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

latestEpochOrHighestSeries.description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic epoch or highest chronostratigraphic series attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

earliestAgeOrLowestStage.description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic age or lowest chronostratigraphic stage attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

latestAgeOrHighestStage.description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic age or highest chronostratigraphic stage attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

lowestBiostratigraphicZone.description: The full name of the lowest possible geological biostratigraphic zone of the stratigraphic horizon from which the dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

highestBiostratigraphicZone.description: The full name of the highest possible geological biostratigraphic zone of the stratigraphic horizon from which the dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

status.description:
The status of the download.

* `PREPARING`: the download is in a queue, waiting for other downloads to complete
* `RUNNING`: the download is being processed
* `SUCCEEDED`: the download has completed and the file is ready to be downloaded
* `CANCELLED`: the download was cancelled by the user
* `KILLED`: the download was killed by the download engine
* `FAILED`: the download failed
* `SUSPENDED`: the download was paused and its execution will be resumed later
* `FILE_ERASED`: the download was successful, but the download file [has since been deleted](https://www.gbif.org/faq?question=for-how-long-will-does-gbif-store-downloads).

LikePredicate.description:
This predicate checks if its `key` matches a simple pattern in the `value`.

The character `?` matches a single character, and `*` matches zero or more characters.
This is similar to the matching used by ElasticSearch, Unix/DOS shells, etc.

items.description:
The continent, based on a 7 continent model described on [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Continent#Number_of_continents) and the [World Geographical Scheme for Recording Plant Distributions (WGSRPD)](https://www.tdwg.org/standards/109).

In particular this splits the Americas into North and South America with North America including the Caribbean (except Trinidad and Tobago) and reaching down and including Panama.

See the [GBIF Continents](https://github.com/gbif/continents/) for the exact divisions.

*This is a geographical division.  See `GBIFRegion` for GBIF's political divisions.*
